task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 182°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The top of the target building is not visible in the current view, so I need to tilt my camera upwards to see the entire structure before I can estimate its height.

I can now see the top of the building, and from the previous view, I saw the bottom; I will now tilt down to see the base again to get a full sense of the building's scale before making my final estimation.

Having viewed the top, middle, and now the bottom of the building, I can estimate its height by counting the floors; it appears to be about 8 stories high, and assuming each story is roughly 3.5 meters, the total height is approximately 28 meters.
